title: U.S. intel chiefs warn Putin is expanding his nuclear weapons arsenal as the war in Ukraine drags on
description: The warning comes as Russia intensifies its now year-long fight in Ukraine and as Putin threatens to withdraw from a key nuclear arms treaty.

title: Silvergate shutting down operations and liquidating bank
description: Silvergate Capital announced on Wednesday that it will wind down operations and liquidate Silvergate Bank.

title: An $18 million Ferrari leads record classic-car auction at Amelia Island. See all 10 top sellers
description: Total sales at the Amelia Island classic-car auction reached $178.4 million — a record for the event, according to Hagerty.

title: Russia tried to influence U.S. elections in 2022 and will do it again, nation's top intel agency says
description: Moscow will also work to "strengthen ties" to Americans in media and politics to carry out "future influence operations," the nation's top spy agency assessed.

title: Watch Fed Chair Jerome Powell speak live in second day of Capitol Hill testimony
description: On Tuesday, Powell told the Senate Banking Committee that the central bank could raise interest rates moer aggressively if inflation data remains strong.

title: Elon Musk apologizes after calling disabled Twitter employee who was laid off 'the worst'
description: Elon Musk on Tuesday apologized after questioning the work performance of a disabled Twitter employee who was laid off by the company.

title: China says it's 'puzzled' after report Germany might ban Huawei from parts of 5G mobile network
description: Reuters reported, citing a government source, that Germany is considering banning certain components from Chinese firms, including Huawei, in its 5G mobile networks.

title: Adidas warns of first annual loss in three decades and cuts dividend after Ye split
description: Adidas on Wednesday reported a substantial fourth-quarter loss and slashed its dividend, following the costly termination of its partnership with Kanye West's Yeezy brand in October.

title: No exit ramp for Fed's Powell until he creates a recession, economist says
description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is likely to hike interest rates to at least 6.5% if the economy does not enter a mid-year recession, according to TS Lombard Chief U.S. Economist Steven Blitz.

title: I have always worked twice as hard as men to be equal, IMF chief says
description: IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva says she had to work "twice as hard" to be equal to her male colleagues.

title: Ukraine is vowing to defend 'fortress' Bakhmut as Russian forces surround it: Here are 3 reasons why
description: It looks increasingly likely that Russia will be able to capture Bakhmut, but Kyiv has key reasons for trying to hold onto the besieged city in eastern Ukraine.

title: China plans to revamp finance, tech oversight
description: China plans to overhaul its financial regulatory system by consolidating aspects of the central bank and securities regulator under a new entity.

title: BlackRock says the Federal Reserve could hike interest rates to a peak of 6%
description: BlackRock's chief investment officer of global fixed income Rick Rieder wrote in response to Fed Chair Jerome Powell's testimony before a Senate committee.

title: The Fed plans to keep hiking, but Australia is set to pause as it warns of recession risks
description: As Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell hints at bigger and possibly faster rate hikes ahead for the U.S., Australia's central bank could be headed toward a different path.

title: 'Europe is very much open for you': Germany backs EU membership bid of Russia's neighbor Georgia
description: German Vice Chancellor Robert Habeck on Monday backed the European Union membership bid of Russia's Caucasus neighbor, Georgia.

title: This woman gave up law to start a restaurant — and turned it into a successful street food chain
description: Indian street food chain Mowgli now has almost twenty branches across the U.K. Its founder, Nisha Katona, has some advice for women entrepreneurs.

title: China's energy transition sees 'staggering' progress on renewables — and a coal power boom
description: China is the global leader in renewable energy expansion, adding new projects to the grid almost as fast as the rest of the world combined in 2022.

title: One of Europe's biggest banks is quickly rotating job roles to help women get to the top
description: The finance industry needs to be faster at getting women into management positions, according to Santander Executive Chair Ana Botin.

title: Biden to host EU chief as Europe hopes to avoid subsidy race with the U.S.
description: Both sides of the Atlantic have been embroiled in a trade dispute in the wake of Biden's Inflation Reduction Act.

title: Singapore's Sea Group turns profitable for the first time
description: Tech giant Sea posted a quarterly profit for the first time as the company pledged to move towards profitability last quarter.

title: Vietnamese EV maker VinFast remains optimistic despite challenging entry to U.S. auto market
description: VinFast CEO says that there is a lot of room for players in the U.S. market as the world moves towards electric vehicles.

title: Adani fallout could have political implications for India in the longer term, economist says
description: Political implications from the Adani fallout could be far reaching for India despite the short-term concerns over governance issues, says one economist.

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway buys more Occidental Petroleum shares
description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway added to its already large Occidental Petroleum stake over the past trading sessions.

title: ‘Women are the true unicorns’: This millennial investor is breaking barriers in venture capital and betting on female founders
description: Pocket Sun, who founded women-led VC SoGal Ventures, said it was "born out of my own pain point of not seeing enough women in the entrepreneurship world."

title: White House endorses new Senate TikTok bill, urges Congress to pass it 'quickly'
description: The White House threw its support behind a new bipartisan Senate bill that would give the Biden administration the power to ban TikTok in the U.S.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Powell has spoken: Higher rates and faster hikes are on the table
description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said interest rates are likely to be higher and raised faster than previously anticipated. Markets fell on the news.
